column4: can I run rsync on a server to call 2 different servers to sync each others? thanks
Assuming server have ssh: rsync -avz /source/ -e ssh user@box:/path/ --exclude=something
but both servers should be able to see each others.. ok
Make sure to not sync dot files between servers
Well, running rsync from ~ or / is bad idea.
servers will be syncing raw files only
i will be syncing raw image files only, and will not sync from ~ or /
rsync have some regex, but better to control it by path, so /my/folder/with/images is better than *.jpg (or whatever)
sure, another question.. can rsync send/write to file a log and state whether sync was successful or not? (with some statistical data)
Sure: Just > your rsync command to data file, like: rsync [all stuff here...] >  `date +%Y%m%d` , and you have your "log" file.
Whatever you do, read man rsync, it is very smart tool, and easy to use for complex tasks.
thanks, i've already used it for syncs over local network, this time i want to set a cron on a remote server to call 2 VPSs and sync b/w them, i will read man pages.
